summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) works to enhance citizens' financial education and ensure that banks, lenders, and other financial companies treat people fairly. The agency spent $711.8 million in FY 2021 to do its work. We audit and issue opinions annually on the Bureau's financial statements and on related internal controls (e.g., processes to reasonably assure that transactions are properly authorized and recorded).
